author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: أَيْ رَبِّ نَوِّرْ وُجُوهَ عِبادِكَ لِلتَّوَجُّهِ إِلى وَجْهِكَ وَطَهِّرْ قُلُوبَهُمْ لِلإِقْبال إِلى شَطْرِ مَواهِبِكَ وَعِرفانِ مَظْهَرِ نَفْسِكَ وَمَطْلَعِ كَيْنُونَتِكَ، إِنَّكَ أَنْتَ مَولَى العالَمِينَ لا إِلهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ المُقْتَدِرُ القَدِيرُ.
translation: Illumine, O Lord, the faces of Thy servants, that they may behold Thee; and cleanse their hearts that they may turn unto the court of Thy heavenly favors, and recognize Him Who is the Manifestation of Thy Self and the Dayspring of Thine Essence. Verily, Thou art the Lord of all worlds. There is no God but Thee, the Unconstrained, the All-Subduing.
